pullRequest.body:
Generalise `pow_ite`/`ite_pow` and give a version of `pow_add_pow_le` that doesn't require the exponent to be nonzero.

From LeanAPAP


---

nodes.body: :v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7453473918/job/20278917380)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7453473918/job/20278917544)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7453473918/job/20278917717)
Why are these needed? Is this a known issue? If so, please mention it in a comment above these lines. If not, please post the bug on zulip.

This is because I need to additivise twice, hence during the second addivisation the already additivised lemmas are already tagged `simp`. This is a genuine linter false positive which I doubt is avoidable using the current `to_additive` machinery. cc @fpvandoorn
